ygData.subject: Re: [archive-crawler] how to manage JVM crashes?
ygData.msgSnippet: Laurian, Heritrix and the DNSJava library are all-Java -- so can t be directly responsible for a memory-access crash like this. The crash log you sent

Subject: Re: [archive-crawler] how to manage JVM crashes?
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=137285340; y=Oh4gR4j6vkwFUW9M79rgCtDD1jbJYXdTrDjArWzZuL_a
X-Yahoo-Profile: gojomo

Laurian,

Heritrix and the DNSJava library are all-Java -- so can't be directly 
responsible for a memory-access crash like this.

The crash log you sent indicated the crash occurred in the runtime's
background finalization thread, with regard to a DatagramChannelImpl and 
FileDispatcher.preClose.

This JVM bug against Java 1.7 ("dolphin") at Sun seems related:

http://bugs.sun.com/bugdatabase/view_bug.do?bug_id=6497734

I've reported to Sun that the bug exists in 1.6 (and based on other 
reports here and in that Sun bug, in 1.5 as well) so that they might 
backport the fix.

Their closed 1.7 bug also suggests the real problem is a depletion of 
file handles, which leaves the channel uninitialized. So you might be 
able to avoid the problem by making more handles available. This FAQ, 
while for a different error, thus may help:

http://crawler.archive.org/faq.html#toomanyopenfiles

- Gordon @ IA

Laurian Gridinoc wrote:
> On 20/04/07, Paul Jack <pjack@...> wrote:
>> I don't believe we ship any automatic recovery tools. Though
>>  something like this could be built using the hcc APIs.
> 
> Is there any recipe to start from command line heritrix on an
> order.xml in recovery mode?
> 
>>  I've opened a bug in case we can fix it on our end:
>>  http://webteam.archive.org/jira/browse/HER-1126
>>
>>  Could I get some more information about your system? Which version of
>>  OS/Heritrix are you using?
> 
> Heritrix 1.12.0
> 
> On RHEL5: Linux 2.6.18-8.el5xen #1 SMP Fri Jan 26 14:29:35 EST 2007
> x86_64 x86_64 x86_64 GNU/Linux
> 
> I have the same crash, in both 32 and 64 bit JVMs:
> 
> java version "1.6.0_01"
> Java(TM) SE Runtime Environment (build 1.6.0_01-b06)
> Java HotSpot(TM) Server VM (build 1.6.0_01-b06, mixed mode)
> 
> and
> 
> java version "1.6.0_01"
> Java(TM) SE Runtime Environment (build 1.6.0_01-b06)
> Java HotSpot(TM) 64-Bit Server VM (build 1.6.0_01-b06, mixed mode)
> 
> So I have in heritrix_out.log:
> 
> #
> # An unexpected error has been detected by Java Runtime Environment:
> #
> #  SIGSEGV (0xb) at pc=0xf4f8b55c, pid=11839, tid=2957699984
> #
> # Java VM: Java HotSpot(TM) Server VM (1.6.0_01-b06 mixed mode)
> # Problematic frame:
> # v  ~BufferBlob::jni_fast_GetIntField
> #
> # An error report file with more information is saved as hs_err_pid11839.log
> #
> # If you would like to submit a bug report, please visit:
> #   http://java.sun.com/webapps/bugreport/crash.jsp
> #
> 
> The hs_err_pid11839.log is attached.
> 
> It seems that a malformed DNS response can trigger this? I'll try to
> see how can I ensure that the DNS server queried is only mine...
> 
> Thanks,
